thread.title: Rumour Mill: Arsenal’s worst Sanchez fears
thread.title_full: Rumour Mill: Arsenal’s worst Sanchez fears

title: Rumour Mill: Arsenal’s worst Sanchez fears
text:
Rumour Mill: Zlatan would be ‘dream signing’ for Napoli, Sanchez and Wenger latest, Dybala deal February 17, 2017 1:44pm by Staff writers Source: FOX SPORTS THE “dream signing” remarks to lure Zlatan Ibrahimovic, the latest on Alexis Sanchez and Arsene Wenger’s futures, and Xavi recommends Jack Wilshere. 
Catch up on the latest transfer links in Rumour Mill! 
ZLATAN WOULD BE A ‘DREAM SIGNING’ 
Napoli president Aurelio De Laurentiis has admitted bringing Zlatan Ibrahimovic to the club would be his “dream signing”. 
The 35-year-old, who scored his first Manchester United treble in the win over St Etienne , is on a one-year deal at Old Trafford with an option to extend it. 
However, he recently said “nothing is done” with his future. If he doesn’t renew a deal with United, then De Laurentiis will be ready to pounce. 
“My dream signing? I always try to go forward with what I have,” he said in an interview with journalist and former mayor of Rome, Walter Veltroni. Manchester United's Zlatan Ibrahimovic. Source: AP 
“One that I would like, though, is that giant who is at Manchester United now. I had him as a dinner guest in Los Angeles and he’s incredibly nice, even though he always seems angry. 
“You know the one I’m talking about, right?” 
Ibrahimovic’s representative, Mino Raiola, said last summer that the striker was keen on Napoli before he joined United. 
Raiola told Italian radio station CRC that Ibrahimovic said he wanted to make Napoli his last club after playing in a farewell match for former Juventus defender Ciro Ferrara. Aurelio De Laurentiis. Source: AP 
ARSENAL’S WORST SANCHEZ FEARS 
The Gunners are worried Alexis Sanchez has decided to depart The Emirates with pressure mounting on Arsene Wenger to leave, according the The Mirror. 
Arsenal were thrashed 5-1 against Bayern Munich in the Champions League, and even those once loyal to veteran manager Wenger, in charge at Arsenal since 1996, have started to question whether the 67-year-old Frenchman will seek a renewal of his contract when it expires at the end of the season. 
Wenger revealed to German TV station ZDF that he will decide his future “in March of April probably”. Arsenal's Chilean striker Alexis Sanchez. Source: AFP 
However, if Wenger leaves then Arsenal reportedly face the prospect of losing their superstar Chilean, who scored the only Arsenal goal in the drubbing. 
Juventus and PSG are locked in a battle to sign Sanchez as he is yet to sign a new deal with 16 months remaining on his Gunners contract. 
The attacker will likely miss Arsenal’s clash with Sutton in the FA Cup after he was given time off from the club to fly to Venice to visit a friend. 
Last month, Wenger said: “Alexis Sanchez is a committed player who wants to stay. I’m convinced we’ll find an agreement. It has to be in our potential. 
“I think no matter what happens we’ll try to keep them and we’ll go as high as we can and if we cannot go further, we cannot go further. That’s basically it.” Alexis Sanchez has been granted leave with the club's permission. Travelled to Italy with his best friend today for a short break. pic.twitter.com/fJXctZFKDH — Chris Wheatley (@ChrisWheatley_) February 16, 2017 
SUTTON COACH HAS NO SYMPATHY 
The manager of Sutton United will have no qualms about doing all he can to add to the burden of Wenger when their teams meet in the last 16 of the FA Cup. 
The tie of the fifth round, at least for those who still believe in the “romance of the Cup”, sees non-league Sutton at home to joint-record 12-times Arsenal. 
Sutton boss Paul Doswell, whose side beat second-tier Leeds in the fourth round, was blunt when asked about Wenger’s plight. 
“Do I feel sympathy for him? No. He is well schooled, and he has been in the job for 20 years,” said Doswell, whose team are currently 17th in the National League, the fifth tier of English football. Bayern Munich outgun Arsenal 1:12 
DYBALA CLOSE TO NEW CONTRACT 
Barcelona and Real Madrid are set for a big blow with reported transfer target Paulo Dybala admitting he’s on the verge of signing a new deal with Juventus. 
The striker signed a deal until 2020 when he joined Juve from Palermo in 2015, and though he hasn’t had as emphatic a season as he did last campaign, he’s reportedly about to sign a new deal. 
“We are very close to the renewal and there is very little missing,” Dybala told Sky Italia. 
“My agent will come to Italy to talk about the last things with [Giuseppe, Juve’s chief executive] Marotta, but the will is there on our part.” Juventus' Argentinian forward Paulo Dybala. Source: AFP 
XAVI: PEP SHOULD ‘CONSIDER’ WILSHERE 
Former Barcelona star Xavi believes Pep Guardiola should consider signing Arsenal’s Jack Wilshere for Manchester City. 
Wilshere has been playing regularly for the first time in years on loan at Bournemouth, and with 18 months on his contract, Xavi urged Guardiola to have a look at the Englishman. 
The Spanish manager last faced Wilshere when Barca took on Arsenal in a 2011 Champions League tie. 
Xavi, who played in that two-legged last-16 match, told Fox Latin America: “I know Pep has always had a lot of respect for Wilshere - he impressed so many of the Barcelona team when we played Arsenal in 2011. Manchester City's Belgian midfielder Kevin De Bruyne (R) vies with Bournemouth's English midfielder Jack Wilshere. Source: AFP 
“He impressed me a lot that night, I know he also did Pep and it will be a player that he would have been following ever since. We have talked about him, it was not a performance you forget easily. 
“Technically he is the sort of player that Pep loves - his only problem has been injuries - and if it wasn’t for the issues he has had with injuries I am sure he would be one of the best midfield players in the world. 
“At the moment he seems to be doing well with his fitness - and if there is a chance to sign him in the summer - I am sure Pep will give it real consideration.” 
- Additional reporting with AFP
